verses.verse: “From (Job 28:12; (Ps. 111:10; Prov. 1:7; 9:10)) where then does wisdom come? And where is the place of understanding?
It is hidden from the eyes of all living, And concealed from the birds of the air.
(Job 28:14) Destruction and Death say, ‘We have heard a report about it with our ears.’
God understands its way, And He knows its place.
For He looks to the ends of the earth, And ((Ps. 11:4; 33:13, 14; 66:7; Prov. 15:3)) sees under the whole heavens,
(Ps. 135:7) To establish a weight for the wind, And apportion the waters by measure.
When He (Job 37:3; 38:25) made a law for the rain, And a path for the thunderbolt,
Then He saw wisdom and declared it; He prepared it, indeed, He searched it out.
And to man He said, ‘Behold, ((Deut. 4:6; Ps. 111:10; Prov. 1:7; 9:10; Eccl. 12:13)) the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom, And to depart from evil is understanding.’ ”
Job’s Summary Defense Job further continued his discourse, and said:
“Oh, that I were as in months (Job 1:1-5) past, As in the days when God (Job 1:10) watched over me;
(Job 18:6) When His lamp shone upon my head, And when by His light I walked through darkness;
Just as I was in the days of my prime, When (Job 15:8; (Ps. 25:14; Prov. 3:32)) the friendly counsel of God was over my tent;
When the Almighty was yet with me, When my children were around me;
When (Gen. 49:11; Deut. 32:14; Job 20:17) my steps were bathed with cream, And (Deut. 32:13; Ps. 81:16) the rock poured out rivers of oil for me!
“When I went out to the gate by the city, When I took my seat in the open square,
The young men saw me and hid, And the aged arose and stood;
The princes refrained from talking, And (Job 21:5) put their hand on their mouth;
The voice of nobles was hushed, And their (Ps. 137:6) tongue stuck to the roof of their mouth.
When the ear heard, then it blessed me, And when the eye saw, then it approved me;
Because (Job 31:16-23; (Ps. 72:12; Prov. 21:13; 24:11)) I delivered the poor who cried out, The fatherless and the one who had no helper.
The blessing of a perishing man came upon me, And I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.
(Deut. 24:13; Job 27:5, 6; Ps. 132:9; (Is. 59:17; 61:10; Eph. 6:14)) I put on righteousness, and it clothed me; My justice was like a robe and a turban.
I was (Num. 10:31) eyes to the blind, And I was feet to the lame.
I was a father to the poor, And (Prov. 29:7) I searched out the case that I did not know.
